oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Panoramic photograph of Camp Sevier, South Carolina
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This panaramic photograph of Camp Sevier, S. C. belonged to Pvt. Guy Bolinger of Blount County. During World War I, the 30th and the 81st divisions trained at the camp. Bolinger served in Co. B, 117th. Inf. Regt., 30th Div. and was overseas from May 11, 1918 until October 8, 1919. He was at Ypres, the Hindenburg Line, Luneva, Premont, and Estress, and was severely wounded on October 8, 1918. According to his family, he survived a gas attack. After the war, he moved to North Carolina.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
